title: Carlton Davis gives his pitch for free agents to join Patriots this offseason
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Carlton Davis praises Patriots' culture, encouraging free agents to join the team this offseason.
Patriots feature a Super Bowl appearance, a respected coach, and strong salary cap space to attract talent.
Key free agents like George Pickens and Jaelan Phillips are potential targets to bolster the Patriots' roster.

title: Where does Milton Williams rank among Patriots’ 10 best free-agent signings ever?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Milton Williams signed a four-year, $104 million deal with the Patriots, including $63 million guaranteed.
Williams ranks 8th among Patriots' best free-agent signings, excelling in quick pressure statistics during postseason.
Williams' first season achievements helped the Patriots reach Super Bowl LX, highlighting his defensive importance.

title: 8 lesser discussed potential trade deadline candidates that could make sense for Celtics
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics likely to pursue minor additions ahead of NBA trade deadline, avoiding major trades.
Possible targets include Nets' Nic Claxton and Mavericks' Daniel Gafford to address Celtics' big man need.
Interest also shown in Kings' guard Keon Ellis and Pelicans' center Yyves Missi for defensive and rebounding support.

title: Something in the Way Fest 2026: Live updates from Roadrunner
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: The second annual Something in the Way festival is held at Boston's Roadrunner, featuring indie and alt-rock bands.
Baltimore's Angel Du$t and Boston's Gollylagging highlight the festival's energetic performances and politically charged messages.
Tigers Jaw announced a new album release and upcoming tour, including a show at The Sinclair in Cambridge.

title: Why the Bruins practiced in a tent on Saturday in Florida
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Bruins practiced in a tent at Raymond James Stadium before the Stadium Series game against the Tampa Bay Lightning.
The NHL erected a 34-foot-high refrigerated tent to maintain ice quality in Florida's challenging climate conditions.
Sunday's game temperatures in Tampa are expected to be in the 30s, colder than the 2023 Winter Classic at Fenway Park.

title: Boston ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest must-see moments
author: Annie Jonas and Samantha Genzer
bullets: Thousands gathered at Boston Common for the 'ICE Out Everywhere' protest against cooperation with U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement.
The protest was part of a larger 'National Shutdown' campaign, held in over 300 cities nationwide calling for immigrant protections.
Participants included advocacy groups, local community leaders, and Boston Teachers Union members advocating for nonviolent resistance and policy change.

title: Photos from Boston’s ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Over 1,000 people protested against immigration policies at Boston Common amid frigid temperatures and snow.
The 'ICE Out Everywhere' rally was organized by Mass 50501 and local groups as part of a national protest series.
Protesters gathered at the State House with signs and musical performances by Somerville's Good Trouble Brass Band.

title: Insider believes Red Sox have ‘another move in them’ this offseason to improve infield
author: Conor Roche
bullets: ESPN's Jeff Passan suggests the Red Sox may pursue a trade for a defensive infielder before the 2026 season.
Potential targets for the Red Sox include Isaac Paredes from the Astros and the Cubs' Nico Hoerner.
Boston might consider promoting Marcelo Mayer to full-time third baseman and sharing second base duties between Romy Gonzalez and David Hamilton.

title: Even Drake Maye’s dad is surprised by Patriots’ Super Bowl run
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Drake Maye's father, Mark Maye, is surprised by the Patriots' unexpected run to Super Bowl LX.
Drake Maye led the Patriots to a 14-3 record, becoming an MVP candidate with a league-leading passer rating.
The Patriots will face the Seahawks in Super Bowl LX, with the Maye family expected to attend in Santa Clara.

title: That guy on TV, Cris Collinsworth, will look familiar to Patriots fans tuning into NBC to watch the Super Bowl
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Cris Collinsworth will call Super Bowl LX with Mike Tirico for NBC, his fourth Patriots broadcast this season.
Collinsworth has commented on five Patriots Super Bowls, including their last Seahawks game 11 years ago.
He highlights the Patriots' adaptability under coach Mike Vrabel as reminiscent of their past dynasty years.
